intro: Disporum sessile var. stenophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved disporum, is a rare variant of the disporum plant native to the Pacific Northwest of the United States. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically shorter and more rigid compared to the standard variety. The plant produces small, white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and role in the ecological diversity of its native habitat.
